entry.title: 7/10 - Haverstraw Riverwide Arts and Music Festival Projex: 6 ‚Ä¢ Juried
entry.content:
Haverstraw Riverwide Arts & Music Festival
üìç Haverstraw, NY, United States
üé® All Disciplines
üìÖ 07/10/2019 deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

$400 Honorarium per accepted submission

JURIED BY: Kathleen Rickling, Director of Public Arts Programs and former Curator at ArtsWestchester, White Plains, NY. Research assistant at Museum of Modern Art, NYC

ADELANTE, THE FUTURE: Water-Front-Parklets ‚Ä¢ Pop-up Art Event

Haverstraw Riverwide Arts & Music Festival is excited to announce a Call for Entry, to its HAVERSTRAW RIVERWIDE ART PROJEX: 6, Pop-Up Parklets. The theme is: Adelante, the Future. To be held in Emeline Park, located on the shore of the Hudson River in the Village of Haverstraw, September 14th, 2019.

In an experimental spirit, we welcome artists interested in moving from the traditional studio, gallery and museum space into the freedom of an outdoor landscape setting with site specific and community accessible art, by making a themed-seating-parklet or vignette, sited on the water front of the Hudson.

PARKLETS: traditionally started by taking a lowly parking spot, encouraging their transformation into parks, playgrounds, pop-up caf√©s ‚Äì anything other than their intended use. We are redefining the concept by asking artists to create a small themed seating vignette within our park.

The Parklets should be an interactive art seating project assembled on-site with a mission to reference any aspect of the ‚Äúcultural landscape‚Äù of this vibrant river town, celebrating the strength of melding its diverse cultural heritage, while it moves future forward over time.

The PARKLET may take form, in any media that can withstand the weather, and site conditions for one day. Re-cyclables are encouraged but not required. Immersive mixed media parklet installations of seating with sculpture, painting, mixed media, tactical and site performance, temporal installations, video, sound projections, or multimedia digital platforms are acceptable.

The festival will include live music, food, craft venders along with NYC, South Street Sea Port's Schooner, Pioneer.

Requests for proposals. Full description: http://www.haverstrawriverwidearts.org
Up to 4 individual artists or adtist team will be accepted.
$400 Honorarium per accepted submission.


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

SUBMISSION DEADLINE: July 10, 2019
WINNER ANNOUNCED: July 22, 2019
DATE OF HAVERSTRAW RIVERARTS PROJEX: 6 September 14, 2019

HONORARIUM: $400 for individual artists or artists teams per selected submission

ELIGIBILITY: Professional visual, sculptors, painters, video, sound projections, multimedia and digital artists, architects, designers and performance artists, are invited to apply.

Required: A digital folder with:

1. A 300 word or fewer proposal that includes the media and scale.
2. Resume
3. Up to 8 images of recent work. (Digital specifications can be found on http://www.haverstrawriverwidearts.org)
4. An image script, which should include title, medium, dimension, and date.

NOTE: Please size your images no larger than 2000 pixels max H or W, at a resolution of 72 dpi and format them as RGB JPGs. You may send up to 8 images. Describe your images in your proposal. Digital images should be in a folder and clearly labeled so that they match the description using two digits (01, 02, 03, etc.) and your name in the following format: LastName_FirstName_01.jpg. Do not submit CDS. All images must be uploaded digitally.

For additional questions about the application, or for specifics of Haverstraw Riverwide Arts & Music Festival Call for Entry, please contact us at: www.haverstrawriverwidearts.org ‚Ä¢haverstrawriverarts@gmail.com ‚Ä¢(845) 708-5098.

entry.title: 7/19 - **Call For Artists: The Other Art Fair Brooklyn** Brooklyn Expo Center, Nov. 7-10, 2019
entry.content:
The Other Art Fair
üìç New York, NY, United States
üé® All Visual Arts
üìÖ 07/19/2019 deadline
üí∞ unknown fee
‚û° Apply


====== DESCRIPTION ======

The Other Art Fair returns to the Brooklyn Expo Center to present its final edition of 2019 (Nov. 7-10, 2019). The Other Art Fair provides a unique platform for artists to showcase their work to gallerists, curators, critics and collectors.

Presented by leading online gallery Saatchi Art, the fair is recognized as the definitive place for buyers to discover exciting and emerging talent. In addition to artwork sales, these four days enable artists to launch their work in the contemporary art world, gauge the public‚Äôs response to their pieces and meet fellow artists for potential future collaborations.

The Other Art Fair in Brooklyn in November 2018 welcomed over 12,300 visitors and attracted representatives from many esteemed New York galleries and cultural institutions such as Gagosian Gallery, Pace Gallery, Elizabeth Dee Gallery, The Museum of Modern Art, The Metropolitan Museum of Art and Christie‚Äôs. This reception was met with numerous sales, commissions and post fair collaborations.

Apply online now: http://nyc.theotherartfair.com

Deadline for applications: January 18

There is no application fee. Stand fees start at $1,880 + sales tax.

As part of our exciting collaboration with leading online gallery Saatchi Art, exhibitors will be presented as fair artists to an extensive network of curators, collectors, interior designers and international buyers via saatchiart.com/theotherartfair, social media and the Canvas blog.

Any questions? Please contact Sasha Ali, Events Assistant, sasha@theotherartfair.com


===== INSTRUCTIONS =====

Apply online now: http://nyc.theotherartfair.com

Deadline for applications: January 18

There is no application fee. Stand fees start at $1,880 + sales tax.
